data.title: "Small and Relaxing"
data.text: A nice place to relax while shopping or visiting. The gentleman that owns the deli was very nice. We had ice cream and a drink. The place has a cool décor and is a throw back to the soda fountain era....

data.title: Outstanding Owner
data.text: They don't make them like this very often. My son and I visited downtown Portsmouth after taking the ferry from Norfolk. We ran in to Noel's for a cold soda. We got a few drinks and an ice cream-my 13 year old loved the ice cream. While sitting there 2 women came in- one in a wheelchair. The woman standing asked what one scoop of ice cream cost. She then got a scoop for the woman in the wheelchair and then Noel wouldn't let her pay. He then insisted the other woman also have an ice cream--on him. Another family came in and it was so uplifting to see how he interacted with the small children and parents. I struck up a conversation with Noel--he is a retired Egyptian cargo ship captain. They just don't make many people like him anymore. I don't know how good his food is but just buy anything and sit and watch. He should be making millions giving seminars on customer service.

data.title: Great Sandwiches
data.text: The place does not look like much from outside but give it a try and you will definitely enjoy.  Not a Jimmy John's!  Each sandwich is made to order - including the slicing of the meat. I had the pastrami and it was very tasty.  The service was great and the owner/operator is very engaging.  A delightful lunch!   The menu is limited to sandwiches and pizza but what more do you need for lunch?  If you are still hungry there is a wide selection of ice cream flavors to finish off your meal.

data.title: Great spot after the Children's Museum
data.text: After spending hours at the children's museum, I stopped here with the kids for some ice cream.  They had a large variety of flavors. I had salted caramel truffle and the kids had birthday cake and mint chip.  Fair prices, but do wish that they had a kid-sized ice cream.  The walls are decorated with dripping paint brushes and it looks really cool. I was happy to read an article on the wall from the newspaper that said the community pulled together to give the deli some spunk with new paint.
